title: Need to Change Your Gmail Address? 5 Workarounds to Try

steps.title: No, you can’t change your existing email address, but there are alternatives.
steps.content: No, you can’t change your existing email address, but there are alternatives. Gmail allows you to create an email alias, which is a secondary email that you can connect to your account and send emails from. You can also redirect (and import) your emails from your old account to your new one. For a quicker, less permanent fix, you can change the name associated with your Google account or modify your Gmail address with a “.” or “+” symbol.

steps.title: Click the icon and See all settings.
steps.content: Click the icon and See all settings . It’s easiest to do this on a computer. An email alias is basically a secondary profile that you attach to your primary email. It allows you to send emails from a different address on the same account, essentially allowing you to “change” your Gmail address.

steps.title: Click on the Accounts and Import tab.
steps.content: Click on the Accounts and Import tab. This tab should be between the “Inbox” and “Filters and Blocked Addresses.”

steps.title: Select Add another email address.
steps.content: Select Add another email address . You can find this in the “Send mail as” section.

steps.title: Type in your name and the email address you’d like to use as an alias.
steps.content: Type in your name and the email address you’d like to use as an alias. Make sure that this is an email account you have access to, whether it’s an old or new one. This second email address doesn’t have to be a Gmail account. [1] X Research source Your name might already be filled in. If you’d like a different name attached, feel free to change it.

steps.title: Check the Treat as an alias box.
steps.content: Check the Treat as an alias box. Checking this box allows the new email address to be attached to your old Gmail address. If anyone emails your old or new address, the message will pop up in the same inbox. [2] X Research source You can also fill in the “Reply-to address” bar if you’d like replies to your emails to go to a specific email address.

steps.title: Click Send Verification to confirm your other email.
steps.content: Click Send Verification to confirm your other email. Whichever email you typed in should receive an email from Google confirming that you want to add this email as an alias. Confirm your decision by following the instructions in the email. You’ve now successfully added an alias!

steps.title: Send future emails from your alias.
steps.content: Send future emails from your alias. As you’re drafting a new message, put your alias in the “From” section of the Gmail interface. Your recipient will receive the message from your alias email, rather than your primary one.

steps.title: Start by making a new Gmail account.
steps.content: Start by making a new Gmail account . In order to redirect your old emails, you’ll need a new address to complete the process. Log out of your existing Gmail account, hit “Use another account,” and click the “Create account” option. This process is easiest to do at a computer.

steps.title: Hit the icon and See all settings on your old account.
steps.content: Hit the icon and See all settings on your old account. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Click Add a forwarding address and type in your new email.
steps.content: Click Add a forwarding address and type in your new email. If you haven’t made your new profile yet, head over to the Gmail sign-in page and click the “Create new account” button to set up your new Gmail address.

steps.title: Click Next, Proceed, and OK.
steps.content: Click Next , Proceed , and OK . This automatically sends a confirmation email to your new Gmail.

steps.title: Log into your new email and confirm the redirect.
steps.content: Log into your new email and confirm the redirect . Follow the onscreen instructions provided in the email.

steps.title: Go back to the settings on your old Gmail account.
steps.content: Go back to the settings on your old Gmail account. You can access it by hitting the gear icon and clicking “See all settings.”

steps.title: Go to the Forwarding section in the Forwarding and POP/IMAP tab.
steps.content: Go to the Forwarding section in the Forwarding and POP/IMAP tab.

steps.title: Select the Forward a copy… option in the Forwarding: section.
steps.content: Select the Forward a copy… option in the Forwarding: section. In the first drop-down menu, choose your new Gmail profile; in the second drop-down address, select “keep Gmail’s copy in the Inbox.” Want to import your old mail to your new account? Check out this guide to get started.

steps.title: Click Save Changes.
steps.content: Click Save Changes . Your email forwarding system is now officially set up!

steps.title: Change the name paired with your Gmail in your settings.
steps.content: Change the name paired with your Gmail in your settings. If you’re more concerned about the name attached to your Gmail rather than the address itself, this could be a good option for you. Here’s how to do it: [4] X Research source Android: Tap “Google” and “Manage your Google Account” in settings. Go to the “Personal info” tab. Tap on “Name” in the “Basic info” section. Hit “Edit.” Type in the new name you’d like connected with your Google account. Hit “Save” to confirm your selection. iPhone/iPad: Open up the “Gmail” app and tap your profile picture. Tap “Manage your Google Account.” Go to the “Personal info” tab. Tap on your name. Hit “Edit” and type in your preferred name. Hit “Save” to confirm your changes. PC: Click here to access your Google account. Go to the “Personal info” section. Click on your name. Hit “Edit” to change your name.

steps.title: Add a period or plus sign to your address to quickly customize it.
steps.content: Add a period or plus sign to your address to quickly customize it. While Google doesn’t let you make big-scale changes to your Gmail address, they don’t care if you make small modifications. Here’s how it works: [5] X Research source Dot (.) Method: Stick a “.” anywhere in your email address; for example, randomemailxyz@gmail.com could be modified to be randomemail.xyz@gmail.com or random.email.xyz@gmail.com. Feel free to use as many dots as you want to customize your email—Google won’t process them, and messages will still make it to your email. Plus Sign (+) Method: Stick a “+” at the end of your email with whatever words or phrases you’d like. This can be a handy way to customize and compartmentalize your email if you run a business; for instance, wikihowbusiness@gmail.com could be turned into wikihowbusiness+customerservice@gmail.com, or wikihowbusiness+orders@gmail.com. Give out this customized email to whomever you want—all the emails will still show up in your account!

steps.title: You might be able to change your Gmail address if it doesn’t have a Gmail domain.
steps.content: You might be able to change your Gmail address if it doesn’t have a Gmail domain. If the primary email domain attached to your Gmail is an “@gmail.com” address, Google won’t let you change it. If the email belongs to an alternate domain, however, Google may let you change your address. Here’s how you can check: [6] X Research source Android: Hit “Google” and “Manage your Google Account” in settings. Hit “Personal info.” Select “Email” in the “Contact info” section. Hit “Google Account email” if your device lets you. (If it doesn’t, you won’t be able to change your Gmail address this way.) Tap “Edit.” Type in your new Gmail address and follow the onscreen instructions. iPhone/iPad: Hit your profile picture in the Gmail app and tap “Google Account.” Hit “Personal info.” Hit “Email” in the “Contact info” section. Tap “Google Account email” if it lets you. (If it doesn’t, you unfortunately can’t change your Gmail address this way.) Tap “Edit.” Type in your preferred address and follow the onscreen instructions. PC: Click here to access your Google account. Click on “Personal info.” Click on “Email” in the “Contact info” section. Click on “Google Account email” if it lets you. (If it doesn’t, you won’t be able to change your Gmail address this way.) Click “Edit.” Type in the new Gmail address you’d like, and follow the onscreen instructions.
